com.wiris.quizzes.api

Interface QuestionInstance

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable

    public interface QuestionInstance
extends Serializable
    The data defining, toghether with a Question object, a particular instance of a question. Concretely
    • The random seed.
    • The student answers.
    • Some local data.
    Further this class can save the result of an evaluation of a question and the set of variables given by the quizzes web service. Then it provides some methods to use this data.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.wiris.quizzes.api.Serializable

        serialize

    • Method Detail

      • update

        void update(QuestionResponse response)
        It saves the evaluation or variables contained in the given QuestionResponse object. Usually this method is called immediately after the QuizzesService.execute(com.wiris.quizzes.api.QuestionRequest). If response contains evaluation data, the evaluation data will be reset. And the same for variables: old variables will not be maintained.

      • updateFromStudentQuestionInstance

        void updateFromStudentQuestionInstance(QuestionInstance qi)
        Saves the content in given question instance that may be changed by the student. It includes the answers and the auxiliary cas applet contents.
        Parameters:
        qi - The student question instance edited by the user.
        See Also:
        getStudentQuestionInstance().

      • isAnswerCorrect

        @Deprecated
boolean isAnswerCorrect(int studentAnswer)
        Deprecated. Use isSlotAnswerCorrect(Slot) instead.
        Returns whether the nth answer is correct according to previously given QuestionResponse from the quizzes service. The first answer is 0, the second 1 and so on. Thus in the case of a single answer give the integer 0.
        Parameters:
        studentAnswer - The index of the answer to check, starting from 0.
        See Also:
        getAnswerGrade(int,int,Question)

      • areAllAnswersCorrect

        boolean areAllAnswersCorrect()
        Returns whether all the answers included in this question instance are correct according to a previously given QuestionResponse from the quizzes service.

      • isSlotAnswerCorrect

        boolean isSlotAnswerCorrect(Slot slot)
        Returns whether the answer entered in a given slot is correct according to previously given QuestionResponse from the quizzes service.
        Parameters:
        slot - The slot that corresponds to the answer being graded.
        See Also:
        getGrade(Slot, AuthorAnswer)

      • expandVariables

        java.lang.String expandVariables(java.lang.String html)
        Given a html with placeholders #a, #b for variables, it replaces each placeholder for its value. Notes: - This object must already have the variable values by having called the update() method of this object. - Placeholders may be inside MathML formulas. - If some mathml is encoded using the unicode symbols «, », ¨, §, then the output will be also encoded. - It will replace the variables by an image tag in case of plotters, by the MathML value in case of variables or by text value if the location does not allow MathML (such as inside a script tag) or if the MathML is not available but text is.
        Parameters:
        html - The source html with placeholders.

      • expandVariablesMathML

        java.lang.String expandVariablesMathML(java.lang.String mathml)
        Like expandVariables(String) but the result is a single MathML equation. This method should be used to produce pure mathematical items such as the correct answer.
        Parameters:
        mathml - The source mathml (or plain text) with placeholders.
        See Also:
        expandVariables(String), expandVariablesText(String)

      • expandVariablesText

        java.lang.String expandVariablesText(java.lang.String text)
        Like expandVariables(String) but only text variables are used and the result is plain text (not escaped for XML/HTML). This method should be used to put formulas where MathML is not allowed such as elements in a drop-down list or in an HTML text input.
        Parameters:
        text - The source text with placeholders.
        See Also:
        expandVariables(String), expandVariablesMathML(String)

      • getAnswerGrade

        @Deprecated
double getAnswerGrade(int correctAnswer,
                               int studentAnswer,
                               Question question)
        Deprecated. Use getGrade(Slot, AuthorAnswer) instead.
        Returns the grade associated to the comparison between a student answer and a correct answer between 0 (incorrect) and 1 (correct). It usually will return one of the two values 0.0 or 1.0, but in the case of a compound answer question with distributed grade it can give any floating point between 0 and 1 as well as in the custom grading function case. The grade is rounded to 2 decimal digits.
        Parameters:
        correctAnswer - The index of the correct answer, starting from 0.
        studentAnswer - The index of the student answer, starting from 0.
        question - Optional. The question object where to find the grading configuration. If null is given then the default options are used.

      • getGrade

        double getGrade(Slot slot,
              AuthorAnswer authorAnswer)
        Returns the grade associated to the comparison between a student answer and a correct answer between 0 (incorrect) and 1 (correct). It usually will return one of the two values 0.0 or 1.0, but in the case of a compound answer question with distributed grade it can give any floating point between 0 and 1 as well as in the custom grading function case. The grade is rounded to 2 decimal digits.
        Parameters:
        slot - The slot for the student answer being graded.
        authorAnswer - The author answer that contains the grading criteria that has been used to obtain the requested grade.

      • getCompoundAnswerGrade

        @Deprecated
double getCompoundAnswerGrade(int correctAnswer,
                                       int studentAnswer,
                                       int index,
                                       Question question)
        Deprecated. Use getCompoundGrade(Slot, AuthorAnswer, int) instead.
        Returns the grade associated to the answer of one of the subquestions in a compound answer question type.
        Parameters:
        correctAnswer - The index of the correct answer, starting from 0.
        studentAnswer - The index of the student answer, starting from 0.
        index - The position of the subquestion to be evaluated.
        question - The question object where to find the grading configuration.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the question is not compound answer or the grading method is grading function.

      • getCompoundGrade

        double getCompoundGrade(Slot slot,
                      AuthorAnswer authorAnswer,
                      int index)
        Returns the grade associated to the answer of one of the subquestions in a compound answer question type.
        Parameters:
        slot - The slot for the student answer being graded.
        authorAnswer - The author answer that contains the grading criteria that has been used to obtain the requested grade.
        index - The position of the subquestion to be evaluated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the question is not compound answer or the grading method is grading function.

      • getStudentQuestionInstance

        QuestionInstance getStudentQuestionInstance()
        Creates a new QuestionInstance only with the data needed to properly render the student's answer page. In particular, it hides all sensible information that would give some information to the student. The result of this method is not intended to be stored but outputted to html. Note that while the object returned is new, it need not to be a full in-depth copy so the contained objects may be shared with this QuestionInstance.
        Returns:
        The new QuestionInstance instance ready to be serialized in the student answer HTML page.

      • setRandomSeed

        void setRandomSeed(int seed)
        Sets a random seed for this instance. Two instances with the same random seed will produce the same variable values and correct answer.

      • setCasSession

        void setCasSession(java.lang.String session)
        Sets the CAS session of this question instance. Usually the CAS session comes from the auxiliary CAS applet on the deliver from of a question when this feature has been enabled.

      • setAuxiliarText

        @Deprecated
void setAuxiliarText(java.lang.String text)
        Deprecated. Use setAuxiliaryText(String) instead.
        Sets the auxiliary text of this question instance. Usually the auxiliary text comes from the auxiliary text input on the deliver from a question when this feature has been enabled.

      • setAuxiliaryText

        void setAuxiliaryText(java.lang.String text)
        Sets the auxiliary text of this question instance. Usually the auxiliary text comes from the auxiliary text input on the deliver from a question when this feature has been enabled.

void setStudentAnswer(int index,
                               java.lang.String answer)
        Deprecated. Use setSlotAnswer(Slot, String) instead.
        Sets the student's answer.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the student answer, starting from 0. For single-answer questions it is always 0.
        answer - The MathML or plain text with the answer math expression.

        Gets the value of the index-th student answer.
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the student answer starting from 0.
        Returns:
        The answer MathML or plain text or null if this instance does not have that answer.
        See Also:
        getStudentAnswersLength()

      • getSlotAnswer

        java.lang.String getSlotAnswer(Slot slot)
        Gets the value of the student answer entered in the given slot.
        Parameters:
        slot - The slot where requested student answer is set to.
        Returns:
        The answer MathML or plain text or null if this instance does not have that answer.

      • setSlotAnswer

        void setSlotAnswer(Slot slot,
                 java.lang.String answer)
        Sets the student's answer in a given slot.
        Parameters:
        slot - The slot where to set the student's answer.
        answer - The MathML or plain text with the answer math expression.

      • getAssertionChecks

        @Deprecated
AssertionCheck[] getAssertionChecks(int correctAnswer,
                                             int studentAnswer)
        Deprecated. Use getChecks(Slot, AuthorAnswer) instead.
        Returns the evaluation of the set of assertions for a correct answer and a student answer.
        Parameters:
        correctAnswer - The index of the correct answer, starting from 0.
        studentAnswer - The index of the student answer, starting from 0.
        Returns:
        An array with all the assertion evaluation results related to specified correct and student answers.

      • getChecks

        AssertionCheck[] getChecks(Slot slot,
                         AuthorAnswer authorAnswer)
        Returns the evaluation of the set of assertions resulting of using the grading criteria contained in the AuthorAnswer object to grade the answer entered into a given Slot.
        Parameters:
        slot - The slot for the student answer being graded.
        authorAnswer - The author answer that contains the grading criteria that has been used to obtain the assertion checks.
        Returns:
        An array with all the assertion evaluation results related to specified correct and student answers.

      • areVariablesReady

        boolean areVariablesReady()
        Check whether the images cache is ready or it must be rebuilt. Image variables are saved in a cache folder. These images can be removed any time, so its integrity must be checked before this object is used to expand variables. If the variables are not ready, the service must be called with a new variables Request and this object must be updated.
        Returns:
        true if the variables cache contains the variables needed by this instance, or false if the variables are not available and hence must be recalculated.

      • setProperty

        void setProperty(PropertyName name,
               java.lang.String value)
        Set a question instance property. Question properties define the question behavior at the integration level, but they are not sent to the service.
        Parameters:
        name - The property name, from QuizzesConstants.
        value - The property value.
        Since:
        3.56
        See Also:
        getProperty(PropertyName)

      • getProperty

        java.lang.String getProperty(PropertyName name)
        Get a question instance property. Question properties define the question behavior at the integration level, but they are not sent to the service.
        Parameters:
        name - The property name, from QuizzesConstants.
        Since:
        3.56
        See Also:
        setProperty(PropertyName, String)

      • setParameter

        void setParameter(java.lang.String name,
                java.lang.String value)
        Set a parameter value. Add or modify an algorithm parameter for this question instance. This method brings the possibility to generate parametrized questions. In order to do so, the Question algorithm should have an initialization command like: parameter name = value so the variable "name" is used later in the algorithm. On this instance, the value of the parameter "name" will be overrided by the value given in this method. A particular use of this method is the localization of algorithms. In such case, the mathml <ms> tag should be used.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the parameter. Must be a valid Wiris Cas identifier.
        value - A mathematical expression, to be parsed using the default syntax context. If null or empty string is passed, then a parameter with given name will be removed.
        See Also:
        Question.setAlgorithm(java.lang.String), Quizzes.newVariablesRequest(java.lang.String, com.wiris.quizzes.api.QuestionInstance)
